result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant STEPHANIE LARUE SALEM in court.  Attorney Michael R. Cohen in court for STEPHANIE LARUE SALEM. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint. Defendant is informed of charges. Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint. Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial
monitoring conditions.
Not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol except for employment purposes only.
Daily PBTs at CHSO: or enroll and actively participate in IDIP: or Soberlink device.
Not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Not to drive with any alcohol in system.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant shall not possess any syringes unless medically required.
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.
Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed.

Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant STEPHANIE LARUE SALEM appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless appeared by video for STEPHANIE LARUE SALEM.
